posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
This is another attempt at me in the search for building the perfect wizard (I tend to do the same with clerics.  I think it's a sickness).

The idear is Auto Still III, high spell DCs (2 shy of max) along with Improved Expertise and Epic Mage Armor.  Cleric 1 is taken early on for free heavy armor and Animal Domain to make him a powerful Summoner and ease of leveling.  My gnome version abandons DCs and goes for EDR III and Auto Still III to make him even harder to destroy.  And that's about all it is.  High AC mage with Discipline, high Concentration, powerful Summoner, and good spell repetoire, and can still craft and set deadly traps.  I didn't find anything in either ECBs that was like this.  Any thoughts or ideas for improvements?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Looks pretty strong GDL
I think the Str 14 is an excellent idea for encumbrance if you are going heavy armor + tower
Rogue would be a decent alternative choice to Monk if you are happy to give up the discipline skill / deflect arrows / monk speed
(You will want to have a free hand to deflect arrows, if this is intended which means either unequipping your weapon or shield)
In terms of second cleric domain, Healing Domain is a good option, to make healing potions and cure scrolls/wands 50% more effective, my healing domain cleric is literally giving away 50-70 healing potions to friends due to accumulation and waving around empowered cure critical wands with 50 charges in parties. Unfortunately it doesn't look like you can take both Animal and Healing on WoG but elsewhere it looks like you can.
Curious about both Silent and Still. 
I wish the saves were better. A wizard 38 / cleric 1 / monk 1 split could allow you to get Epic Fortitude as a general epic feat whilst keeping everything else. You'd get two extra caster levels at the cost of skill dumps, and the other monk stuff mentioned. Dunno if its worth it

Hope that helps, feels like I wouldn't change what you have built except maybe take Rogue instead of Monk but that might just be my preference maybe drop silent for great fortitude but maybe you have some secret strategy in your pocket I don't know about

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I know I'm no arcanist, but won't monk speed be negated if wearing heavy armour? I know you don't take Monk 3 until level 39, but even so...

While I'm on armour, if you're taking your Cleric level early for heavy armour and summons, would it not make sense to take Silent and Still earlier in the schemata? As I say, it's not my area of expertise, so more of a question than a suggestion.

Cheers

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
I wouldn't plan on using Still until much later, probably when I grabbed Auto Still.  I would still play as a straight up Wizard.  The Silent Spell, in my opinion, doesn't become useful until you open up 6th and 7th level spell slots, so I tend to push those back in a build like this.  Regarding Monk Speed and Deflect Arrows, those weren't considered aspects for this particular type of caster.

@Orion2019 , I too thought about Rogue in this situation.  However, with both Wizard, Monk and Cleric classes, he basically has a built in UMD.  So I went Monk for the quick Evasion and Discipline investments only.  I thought the Discipline made more sense thematically since he can stand in there with highish ACs and fling some pew pews.  The Healing Domain won't work in a build like this since he can't even cast a simple Cure Minor Wounds with his 8 Wisdom.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: If you're only using cleric for animal domain and heavy armor then you might be better off switching to something like Rog2/Wiz36/Figh2. You swap animal domain for 2 fighter feats, plus since you're wearing armor Rogue gives UMD at no real cost. The main problem would be making it playable since it only has 2 Rogue dumps (or 1 if you optimise for 40 and start with Rogue).
